title: Moments Of Awakening
summary:
Key ideas:
- The brain struggles to meditate when tired
- Complicating simple tasks is common when tired
- The feeling of clarifying a seemingly insurmountable problem is satisfying.
- Various ideas can evoke this feeling, including consequentialism and logical positivism

Key learnings:
- Avoid meditating when tired
- When faced with a difficult problem, seek out ways to simplify it to identify available pathways

Key questions:
- What is the most effective means of simplifying complex tasks?
- Is there a pattern to which ideas evoke a sense of clarity?
